chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm
Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm
Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travonie Deshane Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travonie Deshane Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin J Peirce appeared by video for Travonie Deshane Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: M. Porter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADJOURNED  OFF THE RECORD.
Case calendared for a Order to Show Cause due to appointment of counsel.
Attorney Benjamin Peirce has been appointed to the case.
Court ordered case adjourned to Preliminary court for Preliminary hearing.
Both parties notified via email.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Travonie Deshane Williams not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Discovery of Information Necessary to a Fair Trial.  (Travonie D. Williams - #2022009153, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Travonie Deshane Williams not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
No driving without a valid license.  
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision.

Defendant Travonie Deshane Williams in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Travonie Deshane Williams in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Travonie Deshane Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
